All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Cell
The cell contains no Constructor because this superclass should not be instantiated as there exists only two types of cell Size of header + payload always equals 512 bytes
Circuit
 
Client
 
ClientProxy
The client communicates through the ClientProxy class.
ClientProxyThread
 
ControlCell
 
Cryptography
Class contains methods for encoding/decoding onions through usage of AES.
DirectoryNode
 
EndNode
 
EndNodeThread
 
ICellMethods
Interface created in order to distribute the use of methods related to creating the different types of cells across all directories/packets.
ISupportMethods
 
KeyGeneration
 
KeyInformation
 
Node
The nodes communicate with the ClientProxy through the use of TLS
NodeReaderThread
In order to run multiple clients (connections), threads are needed for each Node-object
ProxyKeyStore
A keystore is created for each circuit The keyStore contains all the sharedKeys of the client proxy
RegularNode
 
RelayCell
 
Selector
 
Server
 
ServerReaderThread
This thread class does all the heavy handling of reading and handling incoming cells All cells that are to be sent from the client to the endNode or other nodes are put into the blockingQueue.
WriterThread
Generic writer thread -> can be used in any class!
